00016 CTileLoader::CTileLoader(int episode, int version, unsigned char *data)
00017 {
00018  m_episode = episode;
00019  m_version = version;
00020  m_data = data;
00021  m_offset = 0;
00022  setupOffsetMap();
00023 }

00025 CTileLoader::CTileLoader(CExeFile &Exefile)
00026 {
00027  m_episode = Exefile.getEpisode();
00028  m_version = Exefile.getEXEVersion();
00029  m_data = Exefile.getRawData();
00030  m_offset = 0;
00031  setupOffsetMap();
00032 }
00033 
00034 void CTileLoader::setupOffsetMap()
00035 {
00036  m_offsetMap[1][110] = 0x131F8;
00037  m_offsetMap[1][131] = 0x130F8;
00038  m_offsetMap[1][134] = 0x130F8;
00039 
00040  m_offsetMap[2][100] = 0x17938;
00041  m_offsetMap[2][131] = 0x17828;
00042 
00043  m_offsetMap[3][100] = 0x199F8;
00044  m_offsetMap[3][131] = 0x198C8;
00045 
00046  m_offsetMap[4][140] = 0x249C2;
00047 
00048  m_offsetMap[5][140] = 0x25B22;
00049 
00050  m_offsetMap[6][140] = 0x25212;
00051 
00052  m_offsetMap[7][100] = 0x11322;
00053 }
00054 
00055 bool CTileLoader::load(size_t NumUnMaskedTiles, size_t NumMaskedTiles)
00056 {
00057  std::string fname;
00058  
00059  if(m_offsetMap[m_episode][m_version])
00060  {
00061   if(m_episode == 1 || m_episode == 2 || m_episode == 3 )
00062   {
00063    CTileProperties TileProperties;
00064    g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(1).assign(NumMaskedTiles, TileProperties);
00065    readVorticonTileinfo(NumMaskedTiles);
00066   }
00067   if(m_episode == 4 || m_episode == 5 || m_episode == 6 || m_episode == 7 )
00068   {
00069    CTileProperties TileProperties;
00070    g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(0).assign(NumUnMaskedTiles, TileProperties);
00071    g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(1).assign(NumMaskedTiles, TileProperties);
00072    readGalaxyTileinfo(NumUnMaskedTiles, NumMaskedTiles);
00073   }
00074  }
00075 
00076  return true;
00077 }
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * \brief This function assings the tileinfo data block previously read to the internal TileProperties
00081  *     structure in CG.
00082  */
00083 void CTileLoader::readVorticonTileinfo(size_t NumTiles)
00084 {
00085  size_t planesize = 2*NumTiles;
00086 
00087  byte *data = m_data + m_offsetMap[m_episode][m_version];
00088 
00089  // Special workaround. I don't know why this happens, but Episode 3 doesn not seems to read
00090  // the plane size. TODO: Check where that value is hidden in the EXE file.
00091  if(m_episode == 3) planesize = 2*715;
00092 
00093  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperties = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(1);
00094  for(size_t j=0 ; j < NumTiles ; j++)
00095  {
00096   TileProperties[j].behaviour  = GETWORD( data+planesize+2*j);
00097   TileProperties[j].bup    = GETWORD( data+2*(planesize)+2*j );
00098   TileProperties[j].bright   = GETWORD( data+3*(planesize)+2*j);
00099   TileProperties[j].bdown   = GETWORD( data+4*(planesize)+2*j);
00100   TileProperties[j].bleft   = GETWORD( data+5*(planesize)+2*j);
00101 
00102   if( TileProperties[j].bleft && TileProperties[j].bright &&
00103     TileProperties[j].bup && TileProperties[j].bdown )
00104   { // This should solve some tile bugs in Episode 2
00105    if(TileProperties[j].behaviour == -2 or  TileProperties[j].behaviour == -1)
00106     TileProperties[j].behaviour = 0;
00107   }
00108 
00109   // Now set the ice and slippery tiles in case we have them
00110   if( TileProperties[j].bup > 1)
00111   {
00112    TileProperties[j].slippery = TileProperties[j].bup;
00113    TileProperties[j].bup = 1;
00114   }
00115  }
00116 
00117  // This is a special case, because vorticon engine handles animation different
00118  // to our new structure. For individual patches it can be adapted
00119  for(size_t j=0 ; j < NumTiles ;  )
00120  {
00121   size_t value = GETWORD( data+(2*j) );
00122   if(value == 0 || value == 1) {
00123    j++; continue;
00124   }
00125 
00126   // stuff for animated tiles
00127   for( size_t i=0 ; i<value ; i++ )
00128   {
00129    if(i == value-1)
00130     TileProperties[j+i].nextTile = -(value-1);
00131    else
00132     TileProperties[j+i].nextTile = 1;
00133    TileProperties[j+i].animationtime = 6; // Time that has to pass in game cycles until
00134                // animation is performed.
00135   }
00136   j += value;
00137  }
00138 
00139  // This function assigns the correct tiles that have to be changed
00140  assignChangeTileAttribute(NumTiles);
00141 }
00142 
00143 void CTileLoader::readGalaxyTileinfo(size_t NumUnMaskedTiles, size_t NumMaskedTiles)
00144 {
00145  byte *data = m_data + m_offsetMap[m_episode][m_version];
00146  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileUnmaskedProperties = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(0);
00147  for(size_t j=0 ; j < NumUnMaskedTiles ; j++)
00148  {
00149   TileUnmaskedProperties[j].animationtime = data[j];
00150   TileUnmaskedProperties[j].nextTile = static_cast<char>(data[NumUnMaskedTiles+j]);
00151  }
00152 
00153  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileMaskedProperties = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(1);
00154  for(size_t j=0 ; j < NumMaskedTiles ; j++)
00155  {
00156   TileMaskedProperties[j].bup    = data[j+2*NumUnMaskedTiles];
00157   TileMaskedProperties[j].bright    = data[j+2*NumUnMaskedTiles+NumMaskedTiles];
00158   TileMaskedProperties[j].bdown    = data[j+2*NumUnMaskedTiles+2*NumMaskedTiles];
00159   TileMaskedProperties[j].bleft    = data[j+2*NumUnMaskedTiles+3*NumMaskedTiles];
00160 
00161   TileMaskedProperties[j].nextTile   = static_cast<char>(data[j+2*NumUnMaskedTiles+4*NumMaskedTiles]);
00162   TileMaskedProperties[j].behaviour   = data[j+2*NumUnMaskedTiles+5*NumMaskedTiles];
00163   TileMaskedProperties[j].animationtime  = data[j+2*NumUnMaskedTiles+6*NumMaskedTiles];
00164  }
00165 }
00166 
00167 void CTileLoader::assignChangeTileAttribute(size_t NumTiles)
00168 {
00169  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperties = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(1);
00170 
00171  // smart tile change is the change style that uses Keen 3. This is vorticon only stuff!
00172  bool smart_tilechanger = false;
00173 
00174  if(m_episode == 3 || smartTileChangerEnabled())
00175   smart_tilechanger = true;
00176  
00177  // At any other case, except some special ones.
00178  // This is the case
00179  for(size_t i=0 ; i<NumTiles ; i++)
00180  {
00181   if( canbePickedup(i) )
00182   {
00183    if(smart_tilechanger)
00184     TileProperties[i].chgtile = (i/13)*13;
00185    else
00186     TileProperties[i].chgtile = (i>=0x131) ? 0x114 : 0x8F;
00187   }
00188   if( isaDoor(i) )
00189   {
00190    if(m_episode == 3)
00191     TileProperties[i].chgtile = 0xB6;
00192    else if(smart_tilechanger)
00193     TileProperties[i].chgtile = (i/13)*13;
00194    else
00195     TileProperties[i].chgtile = 0x8F;
00196   }
00197  }
00198 }
00199 
00200 bool CTileLoader::canbePickedup(int tile)
00201 {
00202  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperties = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(1);
00203  return ((TileProperties[tile].behaviour >= 6 &&
00204     TileProperties[tile].behaviour <= 21 &&
00205     TileProperties[tile].behaviour != 17) ||
00206    TileProperties[tile].behaviour == 27 ||
00207    TileProperties[tile].behaviour == 28);
00208 }
00209 
00210 bool CTileLoader::isaDoor(int tile)
00211 {
00212  std::vector<CTileProperties> &TileProperties = g_pBehaviorEngine->getTileProperties(1);
00213  return (TileProperties[tile].behaviour >= 2 && TileProperties[tile].behaviour <= 5);
00214 }
00215 
00216 /**
00217  * \brief This will read the code for changed tiles in the exe files. Some
00218  * mods use that in Episode 1 for the smart tile change. Also see
00219  * assignChangeTileAttribute()
00220  * %patch $4409      $26 $8B $07 $B6 $0D $F6 $FE
00221  * %patch $4410  $F6 $EE $26 $89 $07 $E9 $60 $01
00222  */
00223 bool CTileLoader::smartTileChangerEnabled()
00224 {
00225  byte *pointertocode = m_data+0x4409;
00226 
00227  byte comparecode[] =
00228  {
00229    0x26, 0x8B, 0x07, 0xB6, 0x0D, 0xF6, 0xFE,
00230    0xF6, 0xEE, 0x26, 0x89, 0x07, 0xE9, 0x60, 0x01
00231  };
00232 
00233  return (memcmp(comparecode, pointertocode, sizeof(comparecode))==0);
00234 }
